qas.question: In addition to textiles, what other industry is Nanjing known for, since the Three Kingdoms period?
Why is Nanjing so strong in textiles and minting?

answers.text: its strategic geographical location and convenient transportation

qas.question: During what dynasty was Nanjing the biggest business center in all of East Asia?
In what dynasty were textiles particularly popular?
During the textile boom, how many jobs were created?

context: Since the Three Kingdoms period, Nanjing has been an industrial centre for textiles and <a0_0>minting<a0_0/> owing to <a1_0>its strategic geographical location and convenient transportation<a1_0/>. During the <a2_0>Ming<a2_0/> dynasty, Nanjing's industry was further expanded, and the city became one of the most prosperous cities in China and the world. It led in textiles, minting, printing, shipbuilding and many other industries, and was the busiest business center in East Asia. Textiles boomed particularly in <a3_0>Qing<a3_0/> dynasty, the industry created <a4_0>around 200 thousand jobs<a4_0/> and there were about 50 thousand satin machines in the city in 18th and 19th century.
